text:
Inman is a city in McPherson County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 1,377 people lived there.
History.
Inamn was created in 1887. It was called Aiken. Its name changed to Inman, in 1889. It was named after Major Henry Inman. He was the namesake for Lake Inman, located about east of the town.
Geography.
Inman is at (38.230355, -97.772773). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Weather.
Inman has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Inman has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 1,377 people, 513 households, and 347 families living in Inman.
Education.
Inman is part of Inman USD 448 school district.
